etymology.description: Depicts a mound or hill, with a shape that suggests an elevated landform.
etymology.interpretation: The character 阜(阜) (fù, "mound") originally depicted the silhouette of a small hill or mound, representing its natural shape and structure.

examples.chinese: 山边的小阜上(山邊的小阜上)，盛开着野花(盛開著野花)。
examples.pinyin: Shān biān de xiǎo fù shàng, shèng kāi zhe yě huā.
examples.english: Wildflowers bloom atop the small mound by the mountainside.

examples.chinese: 古道尽头有阜(古道盡頭有阜)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ dào jìn tóu yǒu fù.
examples.english: There is a mound at the end of the ancient road.
